relation: Great for these types of students
Lots of security that are kind and courteous.
Students that aren't sure what they want to do for a living.
Plenty of sports and after school activities.
Expensive, 3-star food. Luckily there are restaurants across the street.
No dorms, but plenty of apartments nearby.
They have plenty for all types of careers.
Study is the main thing. This school is still a college, even if it is only a primarily 2-year one.
Small classrooms are nice. Teachers develop personal relationship with students. Food could be better.
pageTitle: Southwestern Illinois College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
textBeforeTable: 12/17/2009 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 1 of 37 Alexander from Waterloo, IL Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: None that I am aware of. Great for these types of students Slackers. Bang for the buck It's cheap and easy so I am just doing my Gen. Eds. Food and Dining Its a small cafeteria in one building. Reminds me of high school lunch room. Dorm Life No Dorms. Academic Rigor Exceedingly easy hardly any effort on my part. Tips for prospective students Good for Gen. Eds. Not much else. In three sentences I give Southwestern Illinois College a C. It's a low cost junior college but I am not challenged and the classes are way to easy. Login to rate or flag the reviews Katie from Collinsville, IL 01/27/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 of 37
